meanings.definition: A device used to measure the penetration resistance of soil or other materials.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a penetrometer to test how hard the ground was.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker relied on the penetrometer to assess the soil's firmness.
meanings.sent3: The penetrometer decided the soil was too tough to play in, much to the disappointment of the children.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a penetrometer, breaking through any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The penetrometer's reading showed the soil was as solid as a rock.

meanings.definition: A tool used to determine the hardness or consistency of a substance by measuring its ability to be penetrated.
meanings.sent1: The chef used a penetrometer to check if the cake was baked perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The quality control team used the penetrometer to ensure the material met the required standards.
meanings.sent3: The penetrometer revealed that the butter was too hard to spread on the bread.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a penetrometer, piercing through her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The penetrometer's results clearly showed the substance's density.
